original_data.Title: Linear Algebra Refresher Course
original_data.Prequisites: The course has no formal prerequisites except experience with some programming language. A familiarity with high-school algebra and trigonometry will also be useful.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.
original_data.What you learn: VectorsLearn the basic operations on vectors (one of the fundamental objects of study in linear algebra).Code a library of functions to perform operations on vectors that you will use in later lessons.Learn the basic operations on vectors (one of the fundamental objects of study in linear algebra).Code a library of functions to perform operations on vectors that you will use in later lessons.IntersectionsLearn the geometric and algebraic interpretation of intersections of "flat" objects and how to solve real-world problems.Write your own algorithm to find the intersections of sets of lines and planes.Learn the geometric and algebraic interpretation of intersections of "flat" objects and how to solve real-world problems.Write your own algorithm to find the intersections of sets of lines and planes.

original_data.Title: Full Stack Foundations
original_data.Short Intro: Build a data-driven web app with Python
original_data.Prequisites: You should be comfortable with Python, including Object-Oriented Programming. If you’d like to brush up on your Python, try the first three lessons of our Intro to Computer Science course. For Object-Oriented Programming in Python, see Programming Foundations with Python.You should also have a firm understanding of SQL and working with a relational database, particularly PostgreSQL. Our Intro to Relational Databases course can get you started if you feel you’re not yet prepared.Finally, you should be able to read and write HTML and CSS without any guidance. If you need a refresher on HTML and CSS, start with our Intro to HTML and CSS course.To complete the final project for this course, it is critical you meet these prerequisites as you are given no assets to begin with and will truly build a complete web application from scratch.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.
original_data.What you learn: Working with the CRUDLearn about CRUD; Create, Read, Update, and Delete.Implement CRUD operations on a database.Use an ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) as an alternative to SQL.Learn about CRUD; Create, Read, Update, and Delete.Implement CRUD operations on a database.Use an ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) as an alternative to SQL.Making a Web ServerBuild a web server from scratch using Python and some pre-installed libraries.Learn how GET and POST requests can retrieve and modify information on a web site.How to add CRUD functionality to our website.Build a web server from scratch using Python and some pre-installed libraries.Learn how GET and POST requests can retrieve and modify information on a web site.How to add CRUD functionality to our website.Developing with FrameworksIntroduction to web frameworks like Django and Ruby on Rails.Use the Flask web framework to develop our own web application.Introduction to APIs and how to add JSON endpoints to our application.Introduction to web frameworks like Django and Ruby on Rails.Use the Flask web framework to develop our own web application.Introduction to APIs and how to add JSON endpoints to our application.Iterative DevelopmentBuild an entire web application on your own.Learn about the iterative development process.Have a working prototype throughout all stages of the development process.Build an entire web application on your own.Learn about the iterative development process.Have a working prototype throughout all stages of the development process.

unified_data.title: Full Stack Foundations
unified_data.description: Build a data-driven web app with Python
prerequisites: You should be comfortable with Python, including Object-Oriented Programming
If you’d like to brush up on your Python, try the first three lessons of our Intro to Computer Science course
For Object-Oriented Programming in Python, see Programming Foundations with Python
You should also have a firm understanding of SQL and working with a relational database, particularly PostgreSQL
Our Intro to Relational Databases course can get you started if you feel you’re not yet prepared
Finally, you should be able to read and write HTML and CSS without any guidance
If you need a refresher on HTML and CSS, start with our Intro to HTML and CSS course
To complete the final project for this course, it is critical you meet these prerequisites as you are given no assets to begin with and will truly build a complete web application from scratch
See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity
learning_outcomes: Working with the CRUDLearn about CRUD; Create, Read, Update, and Delete
Implement CRUD operations on a database
Use an ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) as an alternative to SQL

original_data.Title: Introduction to Python Programming
original_data.Short Intro: Learn to solve practical problems with Python.
original_data.Prequisites: This course is ideal for students who are new to Python, but have some experience programming in another language. If you're a complete beginner to programming, we recommend checking out the Learn to Code program, which will help you understand how code is used all over the web.  See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

original_data.Title: Unsupervised Machine Learning
original_data.Short Intro: Learn how to distill messy data into meaningful groups with unsupervised machine learning! By the end of this course, you’ll know how to perform cluster analyses and dimensionality reduction using Python’s powerful machine-learning package, scikit-learn.
original_data.Prequisites: Intermediate Python, basic understanding of Machine Learning and Supervised Learning concepts.
original_data.What you learn: Unsupervised learning gives you the power to find common patterns within data without knowing what to look for, and its application is virtually limitless — from market segmentation to computer vision to fraud detection. In this course, you’ll learn a multitude of techniques, including hierarchical and density-based clustering, gaussian mixture models, cluster validation, principal component analysis (PCA), and independent component analysis (ICA). In addition, you’ll apply what you’ve learned to identify customer segments within complex demographic data for a mail-order sales company.

unified_data.title: Unsupervised Machine Learning
unified_data.description: Learn how to distill messy data into meaningful groups with unsupervised machine learning! By the end of this course, you’ll know how to perform cluster analyses and dimensionality reduction using Python’s powerful machine-learning package, scikit-learn.
prerequisites: Intermediate Python, basic understanding of Machine Learning and Supervised Learning concepts
learning_outcomes: Unsupervised learning gives you the power to find common patterns within data without knowing what to look for, and its application is virtually limitless — from market segmentation to computer vision to fraud detection

In this course, you’ll learn a multitude of techniques, including hierarchical and density-based clustering, gaussian mixture models, cluster validation, principal component analysis (PCA), and independent component analysis (ICA)
In addition, you’ll apply what you’ve learned to identify customer segments within complex demographic data for a mail-order sales company

original_data.Title: Introduction to Data Analysis
original_data.Short Intro: Start your data science journey right with this hands-on introduction to the discipline of data analysis. In this course you'll learn the 5 key stages of the data analysis process and apply them to real data sets using Python libraries NumPy, pandas, and Matplotlib.
original_data.What you learn: Data analysis is a rigorous discipline that can reveal illuminating insights, but a strong grasp of the fundamentals is essential to generating accurate, useful results. This hands-on course will teach you the industry-standard framework for analyzing data of any kind, and show you how to apply it using some of the most popular tools in data science.

unified_data.title: Introduction to Data Analysis
unified_data.description: Start your data science journey right with this hands-on introduction to the discipline of data analysis. In this course you'll learn the 5 key stages of the data analysis process and apply them to real data sets using Python libraries NumPy, pandas, and Matplotlib.
prerequisites: Basic Python programming
Basic algebra concepts
learning_outcomes: Data analysis is a rigorous discipline that can reveal illuminating insights, but a strong grasp of the fundamentals is essential to generating accurate, useful results
This hands-on course will teach you the industry-standard framework for analyzing data of any kind, and show you how to apply it using some of the most popular tools in data science

original_data.Title: Data Wrangling
original_data.Short Intro: Learn the most efficient methods for gathering raw “dirty” data and cleaning it up for analysis. After finishing this course, you’ll be able to gather messy data from a variety of sources and “tidy” it up in no time using the powerful Python library, pandas.
original_data.What you learn: Knowing how to “wrangle data” (aka write code that cleans up “dirty” data and shapes it into useful formats) is a universally sought-after skill across data-driven companies. In this course you’ll learn how to leverage the power of Python to quickly gather, assess & clean messy data so it can be explored and analyzed easily.

unified_data.title: Data Wrangling
unified_data.description: Learn the most efficient methods for gathering raw “dirty” data and cleaning it up for analysis. After finishing this course, you’ll be able to gather messy data from a variety of sources and “tidy” it up in no time using the powerful Python library, pandas.
prerequisites: Python & SQL
learning_outcomes: Knowing how to “wrangle data” (aka write code that cleans up “dirty” data and shapes it into useful formats) is a universally sought-after skill across data-driven companies
In this course you’ll learn how to leverage the power of Python to quickly gather, assess & clean messy data so it can be explored and analyzed easily

original_data.Title: Data Visualization with Python
original_data.Short Intro: Discover how data visualization can communicate insights far more effectively than text or tables. In this course, you’ll learn how to build data visualizations programmatically using Python, and how you can use visualization to both discover and convey trends in your data.
original_data.Prequisites: Basic Python skill, statistics and probability concepts.
original_data.What you learn: Data visualization allows us to instantly see patterns in data that would otherwise be impossible to detect. Without visualization, humans would be unable to make sense of even small amounts of data, let alone the trillions of megabytes now generated every day. In this course, you’ll learn how to create illuminating charts of your data analyses, so you can convey findings to others in the most impactful way possible.

original_data.Title: How to Become a Data Analyst
original_data.Short Intro: Use Python, SQL, and statistics to uncover insights, communicate critical findings, and create data-driven solutions
original_data.Courses: Data Analysis with Python and SQL
original_data.Prequisites: You should have experience working with Python (specifically NumPy and Pandas) and SQL.
original_data.What you learn: Advance your programming skills and refine your ability to work with messy, complex datasets. You’ll learn to manipulate and prepare data for analysis, and create visualizations for data exploration. Finally, you’ll learn to use your data skills to tell a story with data.

unified_data.title: How to Become a Data Analyst

prerequisites: You should have experience working with Python (specifically NumPy and Pandas) and SQL
learning_outcomes: Advance your programming skills and refine your ability to work with messy, complex datasets
You’ll learn to manipulate and prepare data for analysis, and create visualizations for data exploration
Finally, you’ll learn to use your data skills to tell a story with data

original_data.Title: Introduction to Python
original_data.Short Intro: Every programmer needs to know Python, including those looking to work in rapidly-growing fields such as machine learning and A.I. During this course, you’ll learn the fundamentals you need to take the next step in your career.
original_data.What you learn: In this course, you’ll learn to represent and store data using Python data types and variables, and use conditionals and loops to control the flow of your programs. You’ll harness the power of complex data structures like lists, sets, dictionaries and tuples to store collections of related data. You’ll define and document your own custom functions, write scripts and handle errors. You will also learn to use two powerful Python libraries — Numpy, a scientific computing package, and Pandas, a data manipulation package.

original_data.Title: AI Programming with Python
original_data.Short Intro: Learn Python, NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib, PyTorch, Calculus, and Linear Algebra—the foundations for building your own neural network.
original_data.Prequisites: Formal prerequisites include basic knowledge of algebra, and basic programming in any language.
original_data.What you learn: Learn the essential foundations of AI: the programming tools (Python, NumPy, PyTorch), the math (calculus and linear algebra), and the key techniques of neural networks (gradient descent and backpropagation).

original_data.Title: Programming for Data Science with Python
original_data.Short Intro: Prepare for a data science career by learning the fundamental data programming tools: Python, SQL, command line, and git.
original_data.Courses: Learn to Code in Python and SQL
original_data.Prequisites: There are no prerequisites for this program, aside from basic computer skills.
original_data.What you learn: Learn the programming fundamentals required for a career in data science. By the end of the program, you will be able to use Python, SQL, Command Line, and Git.

unified_data.title: Programming for Data Science with Python

learning_outcomes: Learn the programming fundamentals required for a career in data science
By the end of the program, you will be able to use Python, SQL, Command Line, and Git

original_data.Title: Learn Intermediate Python
original_data.Short Intro: Gain practitioner-level skills with Python and learn the language powering transformation in Data Science, Machine Learning, and beyond.
original_data.Prequisites: Basic familiarity with programming in Python.
original_data.What you learn: Python is a general-purpose coding language with applications in web development, data science, machine learning, fintech and more. The Intermediate Python Nanodegree program equips you to leverage the capabilities of Python and streamline the functionality of applications that perform complex tasks, such as classifying files, data mining a webpage, etc. By the end of the program, you’ll have a portfolio that demonstrates your ability to apply practicioner-level Python skills on the job.
